Sentencas: Hybrid direct carbon fuel cells (HDCFCs) consisting of a solid carbon (carbon black)-molten carbonate ((62-38 wt% Li-K)(2)CO3) mixtures in the anode chamber of an anode-supported solid oxide fuel cell type full-cell are tested for their electrochemical performance between 700 and 800 degrees C. Performance was investigated using current-voltage-power density curves.
Titulo: Catalytic Enhancement of Carbon Black and Coal-Fueled Hybrid Direct Carbon Fuel Cells

Sentencas: In the anode chamber, catalysts are mixed with the carbon-carbonate mixture.
Titulo: Catalytic Enhancement of Carbon Black and Coal-Fueled Hybrid Direct Carbon Fuel Cells

Sentencas: These catalysts include various manganese oxides (MnO2, Mn2O3, Mn3O4, MnO), metal carbonates (Ag2CO3, MnCO3, Ce-2(CO3)(3)), metals (Ag, Ce, Ni), doped-ceria (CeO2, Ce1-xGdxO2-x/2, Ce1-xREExO2-delta (REE = Pr, Sm)) and metal oxides (LiMn2O4, Ag2O).
Titulo: Catalytic Enhancement of Carbon Black and Coal-Fueled Hybrid Direct Carbon Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Materials showing the highest activity in carbon black (Mn2O3, CeO2, Ce0.6Pr0.4O2-delta, Ag2O) were subsequently tested for catalytic activity toward bituminous coal, as revealed by both I-V-P curves and electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS).
Titulo: Catalytic Enhancement of Carbon Black and Coal-Fueled Hybrid Direct Carbon Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Catalytic activity was evaluated as a function of various physical characteristics of doped ceria and manganese-based materials.
Titulo: Catalytic Enhancement of Carbon Black and Coal-Fueled Hybrid Direct Carbon Fuel Cells
